sub_title: Technical Procurement Specialist | Sr. Project Lead Buyer | Iv-Offshore & Energy | Procurement Engineer at Mulder Innovation & Procurement
summary: I am a Procurement Engineer with a passion for technology. 15+ years of experience in contracting services worth up to 20M/year. Managed multiple projects ranging from EUR 100K-5.0M in budget. Identifying trends in the market and act upon. Business development and supporting sales by introduction of simulating techniques for large change proposals. Compiling proposals and tenders for international bids. Follow up on a regular basis with our suppliers and clients. Maintaining daily contact with clients and suppliers worldwide. Introduction of frame agreements with suppliers and clients on Terms & Conditions of Purchase or Sale. Introduction of Software License Agreements into our business. Member of advisory board for the development of a international freight management system. Visiting satellite offices and working sites to support local business. Professional working or bilingual proficiency in several languages.

', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Klaas-Jan', 'last_name': 'Mulder', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Technical Procurement Specialist | Sr. Project Lead Buyer | Iv-Offshore & Energy | Procurement Engineer at Mulder Innovation & Procurement'}]}, {'title': 'Constanza Beach Rehabilitation', 'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'description': 'Area: Europe / Region: South East Europe
Country: Romania / Location: North and South of Constanza
Subcontractors: SC Romair Consulting SRL
Client: Administratia Bazinala de Apa Dobrogea - Litoral
Start: 31 July 2013 / Finished: 28 Jan. 2015

Project summary: Van Oord SCT Joint Venture has been contracted for 4 out of 5 lots of the project ‘Protection and Rehabilitation of the Southern Part of the Romanian Black Sea’. The execution of works started in September 2013.

The purpose of the project is to provide a coastal protection system which reduces the risks of erosion and potential associated flooding.

The works that are needed to fulfil this purpose are rehabilitation and extension of existing groynes/breakwaters, construction of offshore submerged breakwaters and extension of beaches with sand nourishment dredged from offshore Constanta.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Klaas-Jan', 'last_name': 'Mulder', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Technical Procurement Specialist | Sr. Project Lead Buyer | Iv-Offshore & Energy | Procurement Engineer at Mulder Innovation & Procurement'}]}, {'title': 'Sofia Offshore Wind Farm', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'description': '1400MW wind farm on Dogger Bank, North Sea. Construction due to start 2021. Further from shore, bigger turbines and technically more challenging than ever before.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Klaas-Jan', 'last_name': 'Mulder', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Technical Procurement Specialist | Sr. Project Lead Buyer | Iv-Offshore & Energy | Procurement Engineer at Mulder Innovation & Procurement'}]}, {'title': 'Alba B3 Gas Compression platform', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'description': 'The Alba Field is a retrograde condensate field located to the northwest of Bioko Island,
Equatorial Guinea. The field, as of August 2008, produces approximately 935 MMSCFD and
68,000 BPD of natural gas and primary condensate from three offshore production platforms
(Alba A, Alba B and Alba C). The gas, condensate, and water production is separated on the
Alba B2 platform. The gas and condensate is transported via pipeline to Bioko Island for
processing, storage and export.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Klaas-Jan', 'last_name': 'Mulder', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Technical Procurement Specialist | Sr. Project Lead Buyer | Iv-Offshore & Energy | Procurement Engineer at Mulder Innovation & Procurement'}]}, {'title': 'Montrose BLP topside', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'description': None, 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Klaas-Jan', 'last_name': 'Mulder', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Technical Procurement Specialist | Sr. Project Lead Buyer | Iv-Offshore & Energy | Procurement Engineer at Mulder Innovation & Procurement'}]}, {'title': 'Aegir 4000T HLMC and RJ Lay Simulator', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'description': 'Project summary: The supply of a simulator for the new built deep water construction vessel AEGIR. The simulator is a coproduction of Huisman and Tree C Technology B.V. The Huisman control systems are integrated and the hydrodynamic responses are calculated by Octopus (ABB-Amarcon).
 
The Aegir is equipped with a 4.000mT OMC and facilities for pipe lay (Reel- and J-lay). All these functions are available within the simulator.
 
This project delivered a full mission simulator installed within the Heerema Academy. In addition a mobile simulator is equipped to assist specific aspects of engineering on desk top computers. A copy of the full mission simulator is installed onboard the AEGIR to support procedure rehearsal, to study last minute changes etc.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Klaas-Jan', 'last_name': 'Mulder', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Technical Procurement Specialist | Sr. Project Lead Buyer | Iv-Offshore & Energy | Procurement Engineer at Mulder Innovation & Procurement'}]}, {'title': 'Extension North Breakwater Constantza', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'Area: Europe / Region: South East Europe
Country: Romania / Location: Port of Constantza
Subcontractors: Royal Haskoning DHV
Client: Maritime Ports Administration of Constantza
Start: 28 Feb. 2013 / Finished: Unknown

Project summary: Constanta Port is the largest maritime port in the Black Sea. The northern breakwater was initially designed with a total length of 5090 m. With the construction of the Southern part of Constanta port in combination with the weather conditions at certain times of the year the need arose for an extention of the Northern Breakwater with 1,5 km. 

In 2013, Van Oord started with the extension of the northern breakwater in the port of Constanta, Romania. The extension of the existing breakwater will be constructed as a rock core, protected with concrete armour units. Some facts & figures;

• 16,000 accropods of 3 m3,  9 m3 and 12 m3
• Some 3 million tonnes of rock will be placed
• 11,000 m3 of concrete will be used for the crown wall
• Works for the core of the breakwater will be performed at a water depth of up to -26 m', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Klaas-Jan', 'last_name': 'Mulder', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Technical Procurement Specialist | Sr. Project Lead Buyer | Iv-Offshore & Energy | Procurement Engineer at Mulder Innovation & Procurement'}]}, {'title': 'Liverpool 2 Quay Wall Package WP 2', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'Project summary: In 2013, the joint venture Bam Nuttall and Van Oord started creating a new deep-water container terminal in Liverpool.

Bam Nuttall will design and construct the crane rails and a new quay wall, where Van Oord will dredge soft alluvium and clay before the quay wall installation. For this task, a combination of water injection dredging techniques and backhoe dredger Goliath will be used. Afterwards Van Oord will install the rock foundation and pipe for the Bootle Northern outfall and reclaim over 2 million m³ of material behind the quay wall. To help consolidation, vertical drains will be installed.

A cutter suction dredger will be deployed to dredge the berth pocket to final depth.

Some numbers:

100,000 m³ Soft Silt to be dredged with Water Injection Dredger
370,000 m³ Stiff Clay to be dredged with Backhoe Dredger
854 m Quay Wall to be constructed
27,000 m³ Rock Armour to be installed
2 million m³ material to be reclaimed behind the quay wall
550,000 m³ to be dredged out of the Berth Pocket with a Cutter Suction Dredger', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Klaas-Jan', 'last_name': 'Mulder', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Technical Procurement Specialist | Sr. Project Lead Buyer | Iv-Offshore & Energy | Procurement Engineer at Mulder Innovation & Procurement'}]}]
